datafield.subfield: Variation in the energy spectra of primary cosmic rays for 2007–2015, according to data from the URAGAN muon hodoscope

Simulations of how secondary components of cosmic rays are generated and pass through the atmosphere are performed using the CORSIKA software package. The relationship between the vertical projection of the local anisotropy vector A$_{Z}$ and the index of primary particle spectrum γ is calculated. The time series of A$_{Z}$ for 2007–2015 are obtained using data from the URAGAN muon hodoscope. Matrix data corrected for barometric and temperature effects are used to estimate A$_{Z}$ . Using the A$_{Z}$ time series, the average annual daily variations Δγ are estimated. Annual and daily variations in the slope of the energy spectrum of primary protons are observed.
